Журавль

Мнемоника

Стремясь разрушить покров 冖 клетки, птица 隹 клювом, словно камнем, полирует прутья. У самца журавля 鳥 прочный, блестящий клюв и внимательный взгляд. Высматривать, блестящий, лоснящийся.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: On the roof there's some type of turkey bird, but thinner and longer. You look closer and realize it's a crane.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the beautiful black and white crane dancing gracefully on the roof. Now that you know what it is, you feel a little bad about calling it a turkey bird.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The crane leans down toward you from its roof perch and squawks, "Too rude (つる)!" You're shocked! You didn't know the crane could speak English, but even worse, it knew you called it a turkey bird.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The crane keeps saying you're too rude whenever other people come close so they know what kind of person you are. Yikes, you really shouldn't have gotten on this crane's bad side.

It often hunts on rivers or shores. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Heming": "Heming is in Jiugao, and the sound is heard in the wild." Zhu Xi's collection: "Crane, bird name. Long neck, curvy body, tall feet, red top, white body, black neck and tail, its whine is bright, smelling Bajiuli."

The feathers of " Crane " are mostly white, so " Crane " can be compared to white. For example, in the Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Fu with a Bamboo Stick": "The old man, the crane has chicken skin, and the head is full of teeth." Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "Twenty Rhymes of Yan Gong Chenggong Fengcheng": "Baishui fishing rod guest, crane and hair Weng in Qingqiu. "

The ancients believed that " cranes " and " tortoises " were long-lived animals. Such as "Huainanzi. Shuo Lin: "Crane Shou Shou Thousands Lives, Swim With Extremely." "Selected Works. Guo Jingchun's "Youxian Poetry": "By asking the mayfly generation, I would rather know the year of the tortoise and the crane?" Li Shan's commentary quoted from "Health Maintenance Essentials" saying: "There are thousands of tortoises and cranes in life, and life is also a thing of life. Taoist words , The crane curls its neck and rests, the turtle hides and chokes. This is why it is longevity." Later, " tortoise " and " crane " are often used as a metaphor for human longevity. For example, Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty "Peng Nv Guan Ci by the Great King of Sichuan": "Wish to pray for the Year of the Crane and the Dragon and the Phoenix Calendar." Wei Xiang in the Northern Song Dynasty "Drunk Penglai. Ting's Comment on Qingshou": "If I wish to increase, the year of the tortoise and the crane will count, and great grace and purple imperialism."

The idiom "Wind and Crane" comes out of "Book of Jin". At the Battle of Feishui in the Eastern Jin Dynasty, Fu Jian lost to Xie Xuan, and the remaining soldiers abandoned their armor and fled. When he was defeated, he was frightened when he heard the sound of the wind and the chirping of cranes. "Book of Jin. "Xie Xuan Chuan": "(Fu) The strong crowds rushed, they are invincible by throwing water to the dead, and the fat water is not flowing. The rest of the crowd abandoned the Jia for the night, and heard the wind, they all thought that the king's master had arrived, and they walked out in the grass. , Heavy starvation and freezing, the dead are seventeen or eighteen." Later generations will use "the sound of the wind" to describe panic, fear, or self-fear. For example, Chapter 102 of "A Dream of Red Mansions": "Jia Zhen Fang is good, Jia Rong and others have become ill one after another. For months after this, the two governments are afraid of trouble. From then on, the wind and the grass are all demon."

humanum_full_description:
從「鳥」，「隺」聲。異體作「鸖」，從「霍」聲。「鶴」是水鳥名。「鶴」的頭小頸長，腳部細長，常於河邊或海岸邊捕食。如《詩．小雅．鶴鳴》：「鶴鳴于九皋，聲聞于野。」朱熹集傳：「鶴，鳥名。長頸，竦身，高脚，頂赤，身白，頸尾黑，其嗚高亮，聞八九里。」

　　「鶴」的羽毛多為白色，故「鶴」可比喻白色。如北周庾信〈竹杖賦〉：「子老矣，鶴髮雞皮，蓬頭歷齒。」唐代杜甫〈遣悶奉呈嚴公二十韻〉：「白水魚竿客，清秋鶴髮翁。」

　　古人認為「鶴」和「龜」都是長壽的動物。如《淮南子．說林》：「鶴壽千歲，以極其游。」《文選．郭景純〈遊仙詩〉》：「借問蜉蝣輩，寧知龜鶴年？」李善注引《養生要論》曰：「龜、鶴壽有千百之數，性壽之物也。道家之言，鶴曲頸而息，龜潛匿而噎，此其所以為壽也。」後常以「龜」、「鶴」比喻人之長壽。如唐代杜光庭〈川主大王為鶴降醮彭女觀詞〉：「願祈山壽鶴年，以奉龍圖鳳歷。」北宋韋驤〈醉蓬萊．廷評慶壽〉：「惟願增高，龜年鶴算，鴻恩紫詔。」

　　成語「風聲鶴唳」語出《晉書》。東晉淝水之戰，苻堅不敵謝玄，殘餘兵卒紛紛棄甲而逃。敗走之時，聽到風聲、鶴的鳴叫聲都誤以為是追兵已至，十分驚恐。《晉書．謝玄傳》：「（苻）堅眾奔潰，自相蹈藉投水死者不可勝計，肥水為之不流。餘眾棄甲宵遁，聞風聲鶴唳，皆以為王師已至，草行露宿，重以飢凍，死者十七八。」後世便以「風聲鶴唳」形容驚慌恐懼或自相驚擾。如《紅樓夢》第102回：「賈珍方好，賈蓉等相繼而病，如此接連數月，鬧得兩府俱怕，從此風聲鶴唳，草木皆妖。」

亦作“寉1”。“鹤1”的繁体字。亦作“靍1”。亦作“靎1”。亦作“靏1”。“鵠3”的被通假字。亦作“鶮1”。亦作“鸖1”。
(1)鸟纲鹤科各种类的统称。我国常见的有：丹顶鹤、白鹤、灰鹤、黑颈鹤、赤颈鹤、白头鹤、白枕鹤、蓑羽鹤等。古代诗词图画中常指丹顶鹤或白鹤。
(2)比喻白色。参见“鶴鶴”、“鶴髮”。
(3)指鹤版书。
(4)星名。见《明史·天文志一》。

Radicals: 宀, 隹, 鳥  (roof, turkey, bird)
Meaning Mnemonic
On the roof there's some type of turkey bird, but thinner and longer. You look closer and realize it's a crane.
Picture the beautiful black and white crane dancing gracefully on the roof. Now that you know what it is, you feel a little bad about calling it a turkey bird.
Reading Mnemonic
The crane leans down toward you from its roof perch and squawks, "Too rude (つる)!" You're shocked! You didn't know the crane could speak English, but even worse, it knew you called it a turkey bird.
The crane keeps saying you're too rude whenever other people come close so they know what kind of person you are. Yikes, you really shouldn't have gotten on this crane's bad side.
